intro: Muehlenbeckia rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf muhlenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Muehlenbeckia rotundata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
